title: Establishment of the Religious Liberty Commission

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a Religious Liberty Commission tasked with advising the government on protecting religious freedoms in America. The commission will study current threats to religious liberty, suggest policy actions, and promote awareness of religious pluralism until its scheduled termination in 2026 unless extended.
potential_concerns: The commissionâ€™s broad mandate to protect religious liberty could lead to conflicts with existing civil rights protections for other groups.
Possible challenges in balancing religious freedom with nondiscrimination policies in schools, workplaces, and government programs.
The order may be seen as privileging certain religious viewpoints and could raise concerns about government endorsement of religion.
Limited term and dependence on funding and presidential extension could affect commission effectiveness and continuity.
Ambiguities in applying conscience protections in healthcare and education could lead to inconsistencies or legal disputes.
